issue.title: Mac OS latest Bitcoin core latest release will not run as Mac OS can't check it for malicious malware, instructed to contact developer ongoing now for at least two months what gives guys I am sure that I'm not the only one to have reported this.
issue.body:
<!-- This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to Bitcoin Core.

General bitcoin questions and/or support requests are best directed to the Bitcoin StackExchange at https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com.

For reporting security issues, please read instructions at https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/.

If the node is "stuck" during sync or giving "block checksum mismatch" errors, please ensure your hardware is stable by running memtest and observe CPU temperature with a load-test tool such as linpack before creating an issue! -->

<!-- Describe the issue -->

**Expected behavior**

<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->

**Actual behavior**

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->

**To reproduce**

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? -->

**System information**

<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? -->

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->

<!-- GUI-related issue? What is your operating system and its version? If Linux, what is your desktop environment and graphical shell? -->

<!-- Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process. -->
<!--- This is normally the contents of a `debug.log` or `config.log` file. Raw text or a link to a pastebin type site are preferred. -->

events.body: There is nothing we can do without any details

Thank you for closing this issue, Mac Pro 6,1 Mac OS 12.1 error message
![Screen Shot 2022-01-24 at 11 21 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18145286/150822175-429af594-9421-474a-a18f-cf7d6b9b3940.png)

The latest bitcoin release at your web site as of today, this issue has been going on since the release of Mac OS 12 last years release of Mac OS 12 I am reporting it today because I find hard that no other Mac OS has not reported this issue, I am using it on a Mac Pro 6,1 os 12.1 Bitcoin core was fully synced and running until the Mac OS 12 last year it resides on my hard drive useless now for months.
Thanks in advance 

> On Jan 24, 2022, at 11:45, Hennadii Stepanov ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> 
> @jgb211 <https://github.com/jgb211>
> Thank you for closing this issue, Mac Pro 6,1 Mac OS 12.1 error message
> 
> Which Bitcoin Core version did you download? Please check its compatibility with your Mac OS 12.1 (see release notes).
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/24140#issuecomment-1020303404>, or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AEKOABUHZGUR3AQFTLEZJVLUXV62LANCNFSM5MVY4RTA>.
> Triage notifications on the go with GitHub Mobile for iOS <https://apps.apple.com/app/apple-store/id1477376905?ct=notification-email&mt=8&pt=524675> or Android <https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.github.android&referrer=utm_campaign%3Dnotification-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_source%3Dgithub>. 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
>

@jgb211 
> The latest bitcoin release at your web site as of today,

If you mean [v22.0](https://bitcoincore.org/en/releases/22.0/) -- it is not compatible with macOS 10.12 Sierra.

The latest version which is compatible with macOS 10.12 Sierra is [v0.21.2](https://bitcoincore.org/en/releases/0.21.2/). Going to reproduce the issue you reported.

This issue has been ongoing the release of Montery last year and you folks have not addressed it

> On Jan 24, 2022, at 12:26, Hennadii Stepanov ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> 
> @jgb211 <https://github.com/jgb211>
> The latest bitcoin release at your web site as of today,

> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

Sorry, I confused macOS 10.12 with macOS 12.1.

here I am replying to you here Mr. Stepanov it is Mac OS Monterey since it was released last year
![Screen Shot 2022-01-24 at 11 21 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18145286/150836867-bf12b072-b3d7-4f05-b31d-f6a8de1b48f0.png)
![Screen Shot 2022-01-24 at 12 28 06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18145286/150836884-cbdeaf2b-5255-4720-a26f-5c8de8e9be32.png)

.
This issue can be closed as it effectively duplicates #15774.

I apologize for any confusion it is Mac OS Monterey 12.0-and 12.1 not Sierra Mac OS latest release since last year I find it hard to believe that this is the first time that the bitcoin dev. Have heard of this issue

you can do what ever you choose but I still can't use bitcoin core on Mac OS Monterey.

> you can do what ever you choose but I still can't use bitcoin core on Mac OS Monterey.

We are aware of the issue, and will work to improve the situation for 23.0. Closing this as a duplicate.

@jgb211 

To run Bitcoin Core 22.0 on macOS Monterey you can use a work-around using a context menu:

1. 

![Screenshot from 2022-01-25 12-51-42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/150963971-d12d14b1-519a-4c9a-81b0-f5d8f38d6669.png)

2. Click "Show in Finder"
3. Open context menu for "Bitcoin Core"
![Screenshot from 2022-01-25 12-52-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/150964160-662d9de6-68ca-4cc5-be83-7b469df7d47b.png)
4. Click "Open"
5. 
![Screenshot from 2022-01-25 12-52-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/150964297-11380be5-2cb5-4d62-be94-09adbd75c270.png)
6. Click "Open"
7. 
![Screenshot from 2022-01-25 13-00-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/150964814-8cc7fb17-526a-41be-820f-484dd6ea8f79.png)

---

Tested on macOS Monterey 12.2 (21D48, Intel).

I followed the steps as following. It works on one of my MacBook Air, but not my MacBook Pro. The screenshot is here > @jgb211 > > To run Bitcoin Core 22.0 on macOS Monterey you can use a work-around using a context menu: > > > ![Screenshot from 2022-01-25 12-51-42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/150963971-d12d14b1-519a-4c9a-81b0-f5d8f38d6669.png) > > 2. Click "Show in Finder" > 3. Open context menu for "Bitcoin Core" > ![Screenshot from 2022-01-25 12-52-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/150964160-662d9de6-68ca-4cc5-be83-7b469df7d47b.png) > 4. Click "Open" > > ![Screenshot from 2022-01-25 12-52-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/150964297-11380be5-2cb5-4d62-be94-09adbd75c270.png) 6. Click "Open" 7. ![Screenshot from 2022-01-25 13-00-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/150964814-8cc7fb17-526a-41be-820f-484dd6ea8f79.png) > > Tested on macOS Monterey 12.2 (21D48, Intel).

issue.title: Mac OS latest Bitcoin core latest release will not run as Mac OS, "you can't open the application 'Bitcoin core'"
issue.body: similar to #24140, but different error message.

issue.title: macOS reports error on shutdown of GUI
issue.body: macOS reports error on shutdown of GUI. "Bitcoin Core quit unexpectedly..." Although this may be hardware related , memory and cpu load seem normal (screenshots and logs attached.) **Expected behavior** Application closes without error message. **Actual behavior** Application quits (and restarts without error or corruption of data) but message persists. **To reproduce** The error message seems to persist every time under normal conditions, (closing the application invokes the message "Bitcoin Core is shutting down, do not shut down the computer until this window has disappeared" Then opens fine on relaunch. **System information** Bitcoin Core 23.0.0 Version: 23.0.0 (23.0.0) Code Type: X86-64 (Native) Parent Process: launchd [1] OS Version: macOS 13.0 (22A380) [log2022-11-11.txt](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/files/9990546/log2022-11-11.txt)

issue.title: Stop the GPG verification madness
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
It's becoming increasingly difficult to automate verification of the releases. For "gpg --verify SHA256SUMS.asc SHA256SUMS" to succeed, all the keys have to be imported. Some keys are not present on public keyservers and keyservers are anyway commonly considered as unreliable. Currently for v23, after importing 27 (!) keys (others are not available) the SHA256SUMS.asc verification still fails.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Reduce the signer list to a set of well known, trusted signers and have their keys optionally signed by whoever verified their identity and is willing to sign.
Alternatively, provide one signature file PER signer, not a global file that always fails to pass all checks.
